column5: Just back from the West Arm.  Although I did not stay at Lakair I managed to make it down to that end of the Lake on both Saturday and Sunday.  I did see some OFC guys and girls and did wave.  I briefly talked with one of you regarding your new motor on your boat. The scenery was breathtaking as the trees were really starting to change colour.  The fishing was average but the company was great as I managed to fish with my dad both days. I did manage to get a few smallies, some walleye, and for me a new PB pike.  Don't know about you guys but I was cold.  Guess I should know by now not to trust the weatherman. Here are some of the pics from the weekend.  Enjoy. Some pics of the fall colours   little smallmouth bass caught on a drop shotted gulp minnow  another little bass caught on the drop shot gulp minnow  this is a more respectable bass caught again on the drop shot but with a 5 ft ultralite and 4 pound test.  fun stuff  One of my small eyes  Although not a big pike by any means, this is a new PB pike for me at 36".

That pike had an enormous head.  I could barely wrap my hand around it.  Too bad the rest of his body wasn't in proportion to it.  Oh yeah and in case you didn't notice, I am wearing a Laurier Golden hawks Baseball hoodie and Waterloo Warrior football trackpants.  Not something you often see worn together. lol

Well you did alot better than I in the fishing department Cudz.  It was a tough week.  As for the pirates as mentioned in my thread, you are right, that one guy, Lee, would not stop talking.  I almost wish I had just taken a picture from afar     They did indeed have several bottles of wobbly pops in plain view  Joey
Nice pics good job. Congrats on the PB pike.
The smallmouth look real dark.. how deep were you catchin them? And nice Pike.
Great report Cudz. Some really nice fish there too!
Some nice ones, thanks for the report...
Bass were in 4 - 12  ft of water.  The water there is tea stained so the it appears the bass have taken on the bronze clolour as well.
Well done,  That smallie looks like it's getting fat.  Nice pike there too.
Great report and pics Cudz  The third picture of the SMB is looking like she was on the feed.....big chunky gut  Congrats on your PB   and Thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice mixed bag of fish.   Chunky Smallie for sure.
Wow Great Report.  Thanks for sharing!  Helps the days at the office go by LOL
Great pics, sounds like a nice trip
